alert.note: Alert for Henry (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 3:16PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Henry, northwestern Clay and southwestern Quitman Counties through 500 PM EDT/400 PM CDT/... At 415 PM EDT/315 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles east of Richards Crossroads, or 8 miles northwest of Fort Gaines, moving west at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Days Crossroads, Walter F George Lake, Bonapartes Retreat, Standleys Store, Otho, Watson Crossroads, Scottsboro Crossroads, Double Bridges, Moores Crossroads, Ricks Place, Garnersville, Screamer, Coates, Bagby State Park, Thomas Mill Creek and Lawrenceville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
